sen.j: 空手は、もともと琉球王国時代の沖縄本島では、手 (沖縄武術)（て、琉球方言でティー）もしくは唐手（とうで、琉球方言でトゥーディー）と呼ばれていた。

sen.e: It is said that the word 'te' referred to "kenpo" (martial art) peculiar to Okinawa whereas the word 'toude' referred to kenpo come from China.

sen.e: However, from around 1901, when schools and colleges in Okinawa adopted karate as a subject of gymnastic classes, the pronunciation was changed from 'toudee' to 'karate,' and karate came to represent Ryukyu kenpo in general, including "te.'

tit.j: 禁武政策の虚実
tit.e: Truth and falsehood of "kinmu seisaku" (ban on weapons)

sen.j: 琉球の沖縄本島で空手が発展した理由として、従来言及されてきたのが、二度にわたって実施された禁武政策である。
sen.e: Traditionally, the kinmu seisaku (a ban on weapons), which were implemented twice, has been cited as the reason why karate prospered in Okinawa's main island during the Ryukyu Kingdom era.

sen.j: 一度目は尚真王（在位1476年 - 1526年）の時代に実施され、このとき、国中の武器が集められて王府で厳重に管理されることになった。
sen.e: The first kinmu seisaku was implemented during the reign of King Sho Shin (reign: 1476-1526), whereby weapons across the nation were collected and strictly controlled by the Kingdom.

sen.j: 二度目は慶長14年（1609年）の薩摩藩による琉球侵攻後に実施された禁武政策である。
sen.e: The second kinmu seisaku was implemented after the invasion of the Ryukyu Kingdom by the Satsuma Domain (the Shimazu Clan) in 1609.

sen.j: 二度の禁武政策を通じて、武器を取り上げられた人々が、薩摩藩に対抗するために空手を発展させたとする説が、従来、歴史的事実であるかのように繰り返し言及されてきた。
sen.e: Traditionally, the belief that Okinawan people, who were deprived of weapons after two kinmu seisaku, tried to refine karate to confront the Satsuma Domain was repeatedly insisted as if it were a historical fact.

sen.j: しかし、禁武政策と空手発展の因果関係については、近年、これを疑問視する研究者が少なくない。
sen.e: Recently, however, many researchers have questioned the correlation between the kinmu seisaku and the development of karate.

sen.j: 特に薩摩藩の実施した禁武政策（1613年の琉球王府宛通達）は、帯刀など武器の携帯を禁じただけで、その所持まで禁じたものではなく、比較的緩やかな規制であったことが判明している。
sen.e: Particularly, it is revealed that the kinmu seisaku by the Satsuma Domain (came into effect in 1613 through a written notice to the Ryukyu Kingdom) was a relatively loose regulation, whereby the carriage of weapons such as a sword was banned, but ownership of weapons was not banned.

tit.j: 手（ティー）の時代

sen.j: 古くは16世紀、命を狙われた京阿波根実基（きょうあはごんじっき）が空手（くうしゅ）にて相手の股間を蹴り上げたとの記述が正史『球陽』にあり、これは唐手以前の素手格闘術であったと考えられているが、その実態は判然としない。
sen.e: The "Kyuyo" (Chronicles of Ryukyu) introduces an episode that in the sixteenth century, when Jikki KYOAHAGON was assaulted by an assassin, he kicked the assassin in the groin through an art of 'kushu (空手),' which is considered to be an unarmed (bare hands) martial art prior to toudee, although there is no clear picture of this art.

sen.j: 明確に、手（ティー）の使い手として、多くの武人の名が挙がるのは18世紀に入ってからである。

sen.e: They include Master Nishihira, Master Gushikawa, Michinobu SORYO, Shinunjo TOKASHIKI, Yomasa AOI, and Choken MAKABE.

sen.j: また、土佐藩の儒学者・戸部良煕が、土佐に漂着した琉球士族より聴取して記した『大島筆記』(1776年）の中に、先年来琉した公相君が組合術という名の武術を披露したとの記述があることが知られている。
sen.e: Also, it is known that "Oshima Hikki" (Notes of Oshima, 1776), which Yoshiteru TOBE, a Confucian scholar at Tosa Province, wrote based on interviews with Ryukyu warriors who were washed up to Tosa, reads that "Koshokun, a Chinese martial artist, showcased the techniques of the martial art named 'kumiai-jutsu' when visiting the Ryukyu Kingdom on the previous year (1775)."

sen.j: この公相君とは、1756年に訪れた冊封使節の中の侍従武官だったのでないかと見られており、空手の起源をこの公相君の来琉に求める説もある。
sen.e: It is considered that Koshokun was a military attaché to Chinese palace, who visited the Ryukyu Kingdom as one of "Sakuho Shisetsu" (entourage of Chinese diplomats for the creation of peerage) in 1756, and there is a theory that the beginning of karate can be traced to this visit of Koshokun in the Ryukyu Kingdom.

sen.j: 元来、琉球士族の間で密かに伝えられてきた唐手であるが、明治12年（1879年）、沖縄県の歴史琉球処分により琉球王国が滅亡すると、唐手も失伝の危機を迎えた。
sen.e: Traditionally, toudee was passed down by stealth among the warrior class of the Ryukyu Kingdom, but upon the disappearance of the Kingdom based on the overthrow of the Ryukyu royal family in 1879, toudee too faced danger of disappearance.

sen.e: Except a handful of affluent families, the warrior class of the Ryukyu Kingdom, a champion of toudee, soon went into ruin, leaving them no room for the practice of toudee.

sen.j: 連合国占領期に連合国軍最高司令官総司令部(GHQ)の指令によって、文部省から出された「柔道、剣道等の武道を禁止する通達」のため、空手の活動は一時、停滞した。
sen.e: During the period of allied nations' occupation, the activities of karate grew stagnant temporarily because of the Notice of Ban on Martial Arts such as Judo and Kendo issued by the Ministry of Education under the orders of the General Headquarters (GHQ).

During the period of allied nations' occupation, the activities of karate grew stagnant temporarily because of the "Notice of Ban on Martial Arts such as Judo and Kendo" issued by the Ministry of Education under the orders of the General Headquarters (GHQ).

sen.j: しかし、この通達には「空手」の文字が含まれていなかったため、空手は禁止されていないとの文部省解釈を引き出して、空手は他武道よりも、早期に活動を再開することができた。
sen.e: However, because the word 'karate' was not printed in this notice, the MOE was persuaded to announce that karate was not banned, and karate was able to resume its activities earlier than other martial arts.

tit.j: 全国組織と競技空手の誕生
tit.e: Birth of national karate organizations and "kyogi karate" (karate for tournaments)
The Birth of National Karate Organizations and "Kyogi Karate" (Karate for Tournaments)
The birth of national karate organizations and kyogi karate (karate for tournaments)

sen.j: 空手の競技化（試合化）は戦前から試みられていたが、試合化そのものを否定する考えもあり、組織的な競技化は実現していなかった。
sen.e: Although attempts to introduce karate tournaments (matches) were pursued before WWII, organizational effort to promote tournaments was not achieved because some karate experts rejected tournament itself.

Although attempts to introduce karate tournaments (matches) were pursued before WWII, an organizational effort to promote tournaments wasn't achieved because some karate experts rejected the idea of a tournament.

sen.j: しかし1954年（昭和29年）韓武舘（現在の全日本空手道連盟錬武会）が第1回全国空手道選手権大会を防具付き空手ルールで実施すると、1950年（昭和25年）に結成された全日本学生空手道連盟により1957年（昭和37年）に全日本学生空手道連盟主催で伝統派（寸止め）ルールによる「第1回全日本学生空手道選手権大会」が開催。
sen.e: In 1954, however, Kanbukan (present: All Japan Karatedo Federation Renbukai) hosted the 1st National Karatedo Tournament under the "bougtsuki karate" (karate with protective gears) rules, followed by the 1st All Japan Student Karatedo Championships (under the traditional-style (sundome) rules) in 1957, which was hosted by the All Japan Student Karatedo Federation that was set up in 1950.

sen.j: 同年には、日本空手協会主催により「全国空手道選手権大会」が開催された。
sen.e: In 1957, the Japan Karate Association hosted the National Karatedo Championships.

sen.j: 1962年（昭和37年）には、山田辰雄 (空手家)が後楽園ホールで、グローブを着用した「第一回空手競技会」を開催して、のちのフルコンタクト空手に先駆けて直接打撃制試合を行った。
sen.e: In 1962, Tatsuo YAMADA (karate expert) hosted the 1st Karate Competition at Korakuen Hall, whereby karate practitioners with gloves fought games under direct attack rules, ahead of the ensuing full-contact karate.
sen.cmt: 「第一回空手競技会」 定訳不明
sen.e: In 1962, the karate expert Tatsuo YAMADA hosted the first Karate Competition at Korakuen Hall, whereby karate practitioners with gloves fought games under direct-attack rules, ahead of the ensuing full-contact karate.

sen.j: 1964年（昭和39年）には、全日本空手道連盟（全空連）が結成された。
sen.e: In 1964, the Japan Karatedo Federation (JKF) was established.
In 1964, the Japan Karatedo Federation (JKF) was established.

sen.j: 1969年（昭和44年）9月、全空連主催による伝統派（寸止め）ルールの「第1回全日本空手道選手権大会」が日本武道館で開催された。
sen.e: In September 1969, the 1st All Japan Charted Contest, which is hosted by the JKF, was held at the Nippon Budokan under the traditional-style (sundome) rules.
In September 1969, the first All Japan Charted Contest, hosted by the JKF, was held at the Nippon Budokan under the traditional-style (sundome) rules.

sen.j: そして、同年同月、伝統派空手に疑問を抱き、独自の理論で直接打撃制の空手試合を模索していた極真会館創始者の大山倍達（おおやま ますたつ）によって、防具を一切着用しない、素手、素足の直接打撃制（足技以外の顔面攻撃禁止制）による第1回オープントーナメント全日本空手道選手権大会が代々木の東京体育館で開催され空手界に一大旋風を巻き起こした。
sen.e: In the same month of the same year, Masutatsu OYAMA, founder of Kyokushin Kaikan, who, becoming skeptical of traditional-style karate, was pursuing the realization of karate tournaments under direct attack rules base on his own philosophy, generated a great buzz to the karate realm by hosting the 1st Open Tournament All Japan Karatedo Championships at Tokyo Metropolitan Gymnasium in Yoyogi, whereby contestants, who were prohibited from wearing any protective gears, fought with bare hands and with bare feet under direct attack rules (attacks to a face was prohibited, except with kicking).
sen.cmt: 「第1回オープントーナメント全日本空手道選手権大会」 定訳不明
sen.e: That same month, Masutatsu OYAMA, the founder of Kyokushin Kaikan, who, having become skeptical of traditional-style karate, was pursuing the realization of karate tournaments under direct-attack rules based on his own philosophy, generated a great buzz throughout the karate realm by hosting the first Open Tournament All Japan Karatedo Championships at Tokyo Metropolitan Gymnasium in Yoyogi, whereby contestants, who were prohibited from wearing any protective gear, fought with bare hands and bare feet under direct-attack rules (attacks to the face were prohibited, except with kicking).

sen.j: 一方の全日本空手道連盟は翌年、第1回世界空手道選手権大会を開催した。
sen.e: The JKF, meanwhile, hosted the 1st International Karatedo Championships in the following year.

tit.e: Upsurge of organizations and circles and diversification of karate
The Upsurge of Organizations and Circles, and the Diversification of Karate

sen.j: このように、空手の全国化・組織化は着実に進んでいった。
sen.e: As can be seen above, karate steadily developed both in national and organizational levels.
As can be seen above, karate steadily developed on the national and organizational levels.

sen.j: しかし、その一方で、もともと流派、会派などが存在しなかったと言われていた空手界であったが、大日本武徳会を機に流派、会派など増え始めていった。
sen.e: On the other hand, since joining the Dai Nippon Butoku Kai, karate--traditionally, karat is said to have no schools and circles--saw an increase in the number of organizations (schools) and circles.

sen.j: 1948年（昭和23年）、東京では船越義珍の門弟たちによって最大流派日本空手協会（松濤館流）が結成され、1957年（昭和32年）4月10日、日本空手協会を社団法人として文部省が認可した。
sen.e: In 1948, the Japan Karate Association (Shotokan-ryu school), the largest organization, was set up in Tokyo by pupils of Gichin FUNAKOSHI and upgraded to a legal entity on April 10, 1957 by the Ministry of Education.

In 1948, the Japan Karate Association (Shotokan-ryu school), the largest organization, was set up in Tokyo by pupils of Gichin FUNAKOSHI and was upgraded to a legal entity on April 10, 1957 by the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: しかし1958年（昭和33年）には早くも空手の試合化を否定する廣西元信たちが戦前からの松濤会を復活させ、独立していった。
sen.e: In 1958, Motonobu HIRONISHI and others, who opposed to karate tournaments, reconstructed the Shotokai school, which had existed prior to WWII, and parted company with the JAS.
In 1958, Motonobu HIRONISHI and others, who were opposed to karate tournaments, reconstructed the Shotokai school, which had existed prior to WWII, and parted company with the JAS.

sen.j: 分裂、独立については他の流派も事情は似たり寄ったりであった。
sen.e: Other organizations and circles experienced similar kind o schisms and fragmentation.
Other organizations and circles experienced similar schisms and fragmentations.
Other organizations and circles experienced similar schisms and fragmentations.

sen.j: 遠山寛賢のように無流派主義を標榜する空手家もいたが、多数にはなり得なかった。
sen.e: Some karate experts such as Kanken TOYAMA espoused the philosophy of karate with no affiliation, but they failed to become the mainstream.
Some karate experts such as Kanken TOYAMA espoused the philosophy of karate with no affiliation, but they failed to become the mainstream.

sen.j: また、全空連の試合規則、いわゆる「寸止め（極め）」ルールに対する不満などから、大山倍達の極真会館に代表されるような、フルコンタクト空手という、直接打撃制スタイル（顔面攻撃を除く）を採用する流派もあらわれ、一大勢力を形成するようになった。
sen.e: Also, backed by practitioners who were dissatisfied with JKF's the so-called 'sundome (kime)' match rules, there emerged organization and circles that advocated the full-contact karate--as represented by the Kyokushin Kaikan founded by Masutatsu OYAMA--, which was characterized by a direct-attack style (attacks to a face is prohibited), and these organizations came to have a power in the karate realm.

Also, backed by practitioners who were dissatisfied with the JKF's so-called 'sundome (kime)' match rules, there emerged organizations and circles that advocated full-contact karate--as represented by the Kyokushin Kaikan founded by Masutatsu OYAMA--which was characterized by a direct-attack style (attacks to the face were prohibited), and these organizations came to have power in the karate realm.

Also, backed by practitioners who were dissatisfied with the JKF's so-called 'sundome (kime)' match rules, there emerged organizations and circles that advocated full-contact karate--as represented by the Kyokushin Kaikan founded by Masutatsu OYAMA--which was characterized by a direct-attack style (attacks to the face were prohibited), and these organizations came to have power in the karate realm.

sen.j: しかし、大山倍達が存命中は一枚岩と言われていた極真会館もまた、大山の死後、極真を名乗る複数の団体に分裂したり独自会派を立ち上げる者が多数出現することになる。
sen.e: However, the Kyokushin Kaikan, which was known for a bond of solidarity when Masutatsu OYAMA was alive, also split into several factions, which named themselves 'Kyokushin,' or many members left the organization to set up their own circles after the death of OYAMA.

However, the Kyokushin Kaikan, which was known for its bond of solidarity when Masutatsu OYAMA was alive, split into several factions, which called themselves 'Kyokushin,' and after the death of OYAMA many members left the organization and set up their own circles.

However, the Kyokushin Kaikan, which was known for its bond of solidarity when Masutatsu OYAMA was alive, split into several factions, which called themselves 'Kyokushin,' and after the death of OYAMA many members left the organization and set up their own circles.

sen.j: そして、極真出身の大道塾空道に代表されるような、打撃技に特化された現在の空手へのアンチ・テーゼとして、空手に関節技や投げ技を取り入れて、かつての空手がそうであった総合武道の姿へと復元を目指す流派などもあらわれた。
sen.e: Also, as represented by Daido Juku Kudo (derived from the Kyokushin Kaikan), there also emerged organizations and circles, which, serving as the antithesis of the modern karate that concentrates on a striking art, aspire to a return to a comprehensive martial art like traditional Okinawan karate by incorporating grappling and throwing techniques into karate.

Also, as represented by Daido Juku Kudo (derived from the Kyokushin Kaikan), there emerged organizations and circles that, while serving as the antithesis of the modern karate that concentrates on the striking art, sought the return to a comprehensive martial art like the traditional Okinawan karate, by incorporating grappling and throwing techniques into karate.

Also, as represented by Daido Juku Kudo (derived from the Kyokushin Kaikan), there emerged organizations and circles that, while serving as the antithesis of the modern karate that concentrates on the striking art, sought the return to a comprehensive martial art like the traditional Okinawan karate, by incorporating grappling and throwing techniques into karate.

sen.j: 型（形とも）と組手は、空手の基本構成であり、昔からこの二つを練習することが基本となっている。
sen.e: Kata and kumite are basic components of karate, and it has been standards to exercise both since early times.
Kata and kumite are basic components of karate, and since early times it has been the standard practice to exercise both skills.
Kata and kumite are basic components of karate, and since early times it has been the standard practice to exercise both skills.

sen.j: しかし、いずれが主であるかは、時代と共に変化してきている。
sen.e: As for which one is more important than the other, opinions have changed with times.
As for which one is more important than the other, opinions have changed with the times.
As for which one is more important than the other, opinions have changed with the times.

sen.j: かつては型の修行に最も価値がおかれていたが、近年では試合制の導入などにより組手重視の傾向にある。
sen.e: Previously, the practice of kata was valued most, but recently there has been a growing trend toward kumite due to the introduction of tournaments.

sen.j: 型
sen.e: Kata
Kata

sen.j: 型（形）とは、一人で演武する空手の練習形式である。
sen.e: Kata refers to karate's solo practice and demonstration style.
Kata refers to karate's solo practice and demonstration style.
Kata refers to karate's solo practice and demonstration style.

sen.j: 各種の技を決まった順序で演武し、演武時間は型によって数十秒から数分間続く。
sen.e: In kata, practitioners exercise or demonstrate various techniques in a particular sequence, with the duration of each kata varying from several seconds to several minutes.
In kata, practitioners exercise or demonstrate various techniques in a particular sequence, with the duration of each kata varying from several seconds to several minutes.
In kata, practitioners exercise or demonstrate various techniques in a particular sequence, with the duration of each kata varying from several seconds to several minutes.

sen.j: 修行者は型の練習を通じて、空手の基本的な技や姿勢を身につけるだけでなく、組手などへの実践応用に必要な空手独特の身体動作を身につけることができるとされる。
sen.e: It is said that through practice of kata, practitioners can not only master karate's basic skills and posture but also acquire body motion peculiar to karate, which is prerequisite for the practical application of karate, such as kumite.

It is said that through kata practitioners cannot only master karate's basic skills and posture but also acquire body motion peculiar to karate--which is prerequisite for the practical application of karate--such as kumite.

sen.j: 空手の型の数はすべて数えれば数十にもなり、すでに失伝した型もあれば、明治以降新たに創作された型（ピンアン等）もある。

sen.j: 組手
sen.e: Kumite

sen.j: 組手は、主に二人で相対しておこなう練習形式である。
sen.e: Kumite refers to face-to-face karate practice style (sparring), mainly done by duo.
Kumite refers to the face-to-face karate practice style (sparring), mainly done as a duo.
Kumite refers to the face-to-face karate practice style (sparring), mainly done as a duo.

tit.j: 決められた手順に従って技を掛け合う「約束組手」、自由に技を掛け合う「自由組手」、さらには勝敗を目的とした「組手試合」が存在する。
tit.e: There are "yakusoku kumite," (prearranged sparring) where players try techniques alternately based on designated procedures; "jiyu kumite," (freestyle sparring) where players use technique freely; and "kumite shiai," (kumite match) where players fight to decide who is a winner and who is a loser.

Point & KO rule karate

sen.j: 極真空手に代表されるフルコンタクトスタイルに加えて、相手が防御できない状態で正確な蹴りが入った場合、ダメージの大きさに関わらず技術点としてポイントを与え、技術的優劣を明確にするPOINTKOルールで試合をする流派である。
sen.e: Point & KO rule karate refers to karate organizations and circles that embrace not only full-contact styles represented by Kyokushin karate but also the 'Point & KO' rules, whereby contestants' mastery of techniques is illuminated by adding technical points, regardless of the magnitude of damage, when a contestant performs an accurate kicking art without allowing an opponent to defend.

sen.j: 胸部への突きとローキックを主体とするスタイルを改め、伝統空手のスピードとフルコンタクト空手の破壊力を取り入れている。

tit.j: 米国テコンドー発展に大きな貢献をしたATAの故イ・ヘンウン会長も、自身がはじめて米国に行ったとき「コリアン カラテ」として自身の武術を紹介して教え、実際テコンドーとカラテの差はなかったと証言した。
tit.e: Late Haeng Ung Lee of ATA (American Taekwondo Association), who greatly contributed to the development of taekwondo in the U.S., also stated that when he visited the U.S. for the first time, he taught his martial art as 'Korean karate,' and there was no actual difference between karate and taekwondo.
